conclusion: Liquid will flow out from points A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Image 1 shows points A, B, C, and D located at the top of the image, where liquid flows out.
Image 2 shows the initial flow of liquids from points A, B, C, and D. The colors correspond to the points: Blue (A), Cyan (B), Yellow (C), and Orange (D).

Image 3 shows the extended flow paths: Blue liquid (A) flows down vertically and then turns right; Cyan liquid (B) flows down diagonally and then turns left; Yellow liquid (C) flows down vertically and then turns right; Orange liquid (D) flows down diagonally and then turns left.

premise: Image 3 shows Blue (A) and Yellow (C) liquids flowing to the right, and Cyan (B) and Orange (D) liquids flowing to the left.
conclusion: Blue (A) and Yellow (C) liquids will flow into container F, while Cyan (B) and Orange (D) liquids will flow into container E.
